tit.cmt: タイトルのため、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: ひやむぎ（冷や麦、冷麦）とは、小麦粉から作った麺の一種である。
sen.e: Hiyamugi is a type of noodles made of wheat flour.
Hiyamugi is a type of noodle made of wheat flour.
Hiyamugi is a type of noodle made of wheat flour.

sen.j: 日本で食され、主に乾麺で流通する。
sen.e: They are eaten in Japan, and they are distributed mainly as dried noodles.
They are eaten in Japan, and they are distributed mainly as dried noodles.
They are eaten in Japan, and they are distributed mainly as dried noodles.

sen.j: 冷やして食することが多く、清涼感を求めて夏の麺料理として一般的である。
sen.e: They are often eaten chilled, and they are commonly available as a cool summer noodle dish.
They are often eaten chilled, and they are commonly available as a cool summer noodle dish.
They are often eaten chilled, and they are commonly available as a cool summer noodle dish.

sen.j: 乾麺については、小麦粉に食塩と水を混ぜてよく練った生地が作られる。
sen.e: For the dried noodles, a dough is made by mixing wheat flour, salt and water, and kneading it well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For the dried noodles, a dough is made by mixing wheat flour, salt and water, and kneading it thoroughly.
For the dried noodles, a dough is made by mixing wheat flour, salt and water, and kneading it thoroughly.

sen.j: その生地を帯状に細く切って乾燥させる。
sen.e: The dough is cut into narrow ribbons and dried.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The dough is cut into narrow strips and dried.
The dough is cut into narrow strips and dried.

sen.j: このような製法で機械にて製造しているものは機械麺に分類される。
sen.e: The ones made by a machine using this manufacturing process is classified as machine-made noodles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The ones made by a machine using this manufacturing process is classified as machine-made noodles.
The ones made by a machine using this manufacturing process is classified as machine-made noodles.

sen.j: 小麦粉に食塩と水を混ぜてよく練った生地に、でん粉、食用油又は小麦粉を塗付して、よりをかけながら引き伸ばして乾燥、熟成させる製法で作られたものについては手延べひやむぎ（てのべ－）に分類される。
sen.e: The ones made by the manufacturing process of mixing wheat flour, salt and water, kneading the dough well, stretching and gathering the dough in bundles by sprinkling the dough with cooking oil or wheat flour, then drying and ageing is classified as tenobe (hand-stretched) hiyamugi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The ones made by the manufacturing process of mixing wheat flour, salt and water, kneading the dough thoroughly, stretching and gathering the dough in bundles by sprinkling the dough with cooking oil or wheat flour, then drying and ageing is classified as tenobe (hand-stretched) hiyamugi.

The ones made by the manufacturing process of mixing wheat flour, salt and water, kneading the dough thoroughly, stretching and gathering the dough in bundles by sprinkling the dough with starch, cooking oil or wheat flour, then drying and ageing is classified as tenobe (hand-stretched) hiyamugi.
sen.cmt: でんぷん を追加しました。

sen.j: この場合、『手延べ干しめんの日本農林規格』を満たさなければいけない。
sen.e: In this case, the noodles also need to meet the "Japan Agricultural Standards for hand-stretched dried noodles."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this case, the noodles also need to meet the "Japan Agricultural Standards for hand-stretched dried noodles."
In this case, the noodles also need to meet the "Japan Agricultural Standards for hand-stretched dried noodles."

sen.j: 日本農林規格（JAS規格）の『乾めん類品質表示基準』にて、機械麺の場合、ひやむぎの麺の太さは直径と直径1.3mm以上～1.7mm未満とされている（同基準を満たしている場合「細うどん」とも表示可能である）。
sen.e: According to the "Quality Labeling Standard for Dried Noodles" of Japan Agricultural Standards (JAS), in the case of machine-made noodles the thickness of hiyamugi noodles should be over 1.3mm and under 1.7mm in diameter (it is possible to use the label of 'thin udon noodles' in cases where this standard is satisfied).
sen.cmt: 『乾めん類品質表示基準』の乾めんは用語集には instant noodles となってますが、 dried noodles が適切だと思われます。訳文には後者を使いました。原文の「直径と直径」は「直径」として訳しました。
sen.e: According to the "Quality Labeling Standard for Dried Noodles" of the Japan Agricultural Standards (JAS), machine-made noodles should be between 1.3mm and 1.7mm in diameter (it is also possible to use the label 'thin udon noodles' in cases where this standard is satisfied).
sen.cmt: Slightly reworded to read more naturally.
sen.e: According to the "Quality Labeling Standard for Dried Noodles" of the Japan Agricultural Standards (JAS), machine-made noodles should be between 1.3 mm and 1.7 mm in diameter (it is also possible to use the label 'thin udon noodles' in cases where this standard is satisfied).
sen.cmt: mmの前にスペースを追加しました。

sen.j: ちなみにはそうめんは1.3mm未満、1.7mm以上はうどんと分類される。
sen.e: Incidentally, somen noodles (Japanese vermicelli) and udon noodles (Japanese wheat noodles) are classified as under 1.3mm and over 1.7mm in diameter, respectively.
sen.cmt: 原文にはありませんが、意味が伝わるように訳文には「直径」を使いました。
sen.e: Incidentally, somen noodles and udon noodles are classified as under 1.3mm and over 1.7mm in diameter, respectively.
Incidentally, somen noodles and udon noodles are classified as under 1.3 mm and over 1.7 mm in diameter, respectively.
sen.cmt: mmの前にスペースを追加しました。

sen.j: 手延麺の場合、ひやむぎも素麺も同基準である。
sen.e: In the case of hand-stretched noodles, hiyamugi and somen noodles use the same standard.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the case of hand-stretched noodles, the same standards apply to hiyamugi and somen noodles.
In the case of hand-stretched noodles, the same standards apply to hiyamugi and somen noodles.

sen.j: 直径が1.7mm未満で丸棒状に成形したものが「手延べひやむぎ」もしくは「手延べ素麺」に分類される。
sen.e: Those shaped into rods with diameters under 1.7mm are classified as 'hand-stretched hiyamugi noodles' or 'hand-stretched somen noodles.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Those shaped into rods with diameters under 1.7mm are classified as 'hand-stretched hiyamugi noodles' or 'hand-stretched somen noodles.'
Those shaped into rods with diameters under 1.7 mm are classified as 'hand-stretched hiyamugi noodles' or 'hand-stretched somen noodles.'
sen.cmt: mmの前にスペースを追加しました。

sen.j: ちなみに直径が1.7mm以上で丸棒状に成形したものは「手延べうどん」に分類される。
sen.e: Incidentally, those shaped into rods with diameters over 1.7mm are classified as 'hand-stretched udon noodles.'
Incidentally, those shaped into rods with diameters over 1.7mm are classified as 'hand-stretched udon noodles.'
Incidentally, those shaped into rods with diameters over 1.7 mm are classified as 'hand-stretched udon noodles.'
sen.cmt: mmの前にスペースを追加しました。

sen.j: 乾麺の生産量は昭和40年代までは8万tを維持していたが、昭和50年代に入ってから急激に減少。
sen.e: The production quantity of dried noodles used to maintain 80,000 tons until the latter half of 1960's to the first half of 1970's, but it decreased quickly from the latter half of 1970's.
The production quantity of dried noodles was once maintained at 80,000 tons until late 1960's/early 1970's, but it decreased quickly from the latter half of 1970's.
The production quantity of dried noodles was once maintained at 80,000 tons until late 1960's/early 1970's, but it decreased quickly from the latter half of 1970's.

sen.j: 昭和60年代に一時的に増加した。
sen.e: During the decade starting from the 1980's there was a temporary increase in the production amount.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the decade starting from the 1980's there was a temporary increase in the amount produced..
During the decade starting from the 1980's there was a temporary increase in the amount produced..

sen.j: しかし、平成に入っても減少傾向が止まらず、平成10年代では昭和40年代の1/4である2万tにまで落ち込んでいる。
sen.e: However, the decreasing trend did not stop even in the Heisei period (1989 -), and during the decade starting in 1998 the production amount fell to 20,000 tons, which was one quarter of the amount produced in the decade starting in 1965.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the decreasing trend did not stop even in the Heisei period (1989 -), and during the decade starting in 1998 the production amount fell to 20,000 tons, which was one quarter of the amount produced in the decade starting in 1965.

However, the decreasing trend did not stop even in the Heisei period (1989 -), and during the decade starting in 1998 the production amount fell to 20,000 tons, which was one quarter of the amount produced in the decade starting in 1965.

sen.j: 乾麺類生産比率において長い間素麺・うどんに続く地位を維持していた。
sen.e: In terms of production ratio among dried noodles, hiyamugi noodles maintained its ranking next to somen and udon noodles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In terms of production ratio among dried noodles, hiyamugi noodles maintained its ranking next to somen and udon noodles.
In terms of production ratio among dried noodles, hiyamugi noodles maintained its ranking next to somen and udon noodles.

sen.j: しかし、平成5年には蕎麦に追い抜かれるなど年々縮小傾向である。
sen.e: However, its ranking was surpassed by soba (buckwheat) noodles in 1993, and the production ratio is following a decreasing trend every year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処, 「年々縮小傾向である」の主語は原文にはありませんが、生産比率の縮小と訳しました。
sen.e: However, its ranking was surpassed by soba (buckwheat) noodles in 1993, and the production ratio is following a yearly decreasing trend every.
However, its ranking was surpassed by soba (buckwheat) noodles in 1993, and the production ratio is following a yearly decreasing trend every.

sen.j: 生麺・茹で麺等については『生めん類の表示に関する公正競争規約』にて、『この規約で「うどん」とはひらめん、ひやむぎ、そうめんその他名称のいかんを問わず小麦粉に水を加え練り上げた後製麺したもの、又は製麺した後加工したものをいう』となっている。
sen.e: Regarding fresh and boiled noodles, according to the "Fair Competition Codes concerning labelling of fresh noodles," "under these codes, 'udon noodles' refer to noodles produced after adding water to wheat flour and kneading the mixture, or to those that have been processed after the noodles are made, regardless of whether they are named hiramen (flat noodles), hiyamugi, somen or others."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Regarding fresh and boiled noodles, according to the "Fair Competition Codes concerning labeling of fresh noodles," "under these codes, 'udon noodles' refers to noodles produced after adding water to wheat flour and kneading the mixture, or to those that have been processed after the noodles are made, regardless of whether they are named hiramen (flat noodles), hiyamugi, somen or others."

Regarding fresh and boiled noodles, according to the "Fair Competition Codes concerning labeling of fresh noodles," "under these codes, 'udon noodles' refer to noodles produced after adding water to wheat flour and kneading the mixture, or to those that have been processed after the noodles are made, regardless of whether they are named hiramen (flat noodles), hiyamugi, somen or others."

sen.j: したがって、この規約上「ひやむぎ」は「うどん」に分類されており、狭義では「生麺・茹で麺タイプのひやむぎはうどんの一種」とも解釈できる。
sen.e: Therefore, according to these codes, 'hiyamugi' is classified as 'udon', and in a narrow sense it can be interpreted that 'fresh- or boiled-type hiyamugi noodles are a type of udon noodles.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, according to these codes, 'hiyamugi' is classified as 'udon', and in a narrow sense it can be interpreted that 'fresh- or boiled-type hiyamugi noodles are a type of udon noodles.'
Therefore, according to these codes, 'hiyamugi' is classified as 'udon', and in a narrow sense it can be interpreted that 'fresh- or boiled-type hiyamugi noodles are a type of udon noodles.'

sen.j: しかし別項にて『一般消費者に誤認されない名称に替えることができる』となっている。
sen.e: However, it is stated in a separate section that "the labeling can be changed to one that is not misunderstood by the general consumer."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it is stated in a separate section that "the labeling can be changed to one that is not misunderstood by the general consumer."
However, it is stated in a separate section that "the labeling can be changed to one that is not misunderstood by the general consumer."

sen.j: それにより『ひやむぎ』の名を使用することも認められており、この規約に沿った製品が実際に製造・販売されている。
sen.e: Therefore, the use of the label "hiyamugi" is also allowed, and in reality, products that comply with these codes are made and sold.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the use of the label "hiyamugi" is also allowed, and in reality, products that comply with these codes are made and sold.
Therefore, the use of the label "hiyamugi" is also allowed, and in reality, products that comply with these codes are made and sold.

sen.j: それらの事例により広義（一般的）には『生麺・茹で麺タイプのひやむぎも存在する』と言える。
sen.e: Because of these cases, in a broad sense (in general), it can be said that "fresh- and boiled-type hiyamugi noodles also exist."
Because of these cases, in a broad sense (in general), it can be said that "fresh- and boiled-type hiyamugi noodles also exist."
Because of these cases, in a broad sense (in general), it can be said that "fresh- and boiled-type hiyamugi noodles also exist."

sen.j: なお、手打ちひやむぎも少数ながら存在し提供している店もある。
sen.e: Incidentally, though few in number, there are shops that serve hand-made hiyamugi noodles.
Incidentally, though few in number, there are establishments that provide hand-made hiyamugi noodles.
sen.cmt: Reworded to add ambiguity as it is not known whether these are SHOPS that SELL them or RESTAURANTS that SERVE them.
sen.e: Incidentally, although few in number, there are establishments that provide hand-made hiyamugi noodles.

sen.j: 機械麺が一般化する以前は、素麺は手延べ工程により生地を細くするため断面が丸く（●）、ひやむぎは生地を薄く打ち伸ばしてから細く切るため断面が四角（■）になっている、という見分け方も出来た。
sen.e: Before the machine-made noodles became common it was possible to distinguish somen noodles from hiyamugi noodles because the cross-section of the somen noodles was round due to the fact that the dough was made thin by the hand-stretching process, and the cross-section of the hiyamugi noodles was square because the dough was flattened and then cut into narrow strips.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Before machine-made noodles became common it was possible to distinguish somen noodles from hiyamugi noodles because the cross-section of the somen noodles was round due to the fact that the dough was made thin by the hand-stretching process, and the cross-section of the hiyamugi noodles was square because the dough was flattened and then cut into narrow strips.

Before machine-made noodles became common it was possible to distinguish somen noodles from hiyamugi noodles because the cross-section of the somen noodles was round due to the fact that the dough was made thin by the hand-stretching process, and the cross-section of the hiyamugi noodles was square because the dough was flattened and then cut into narrow strips.

sen.j: しかし、現在のひやむぎは素麺とほぼ同じ製法で作られているためこの見分け方法は不適となってしまった。
sen.e: However, hiyamugi noodles nowadays are made by almost the same manufacturing method as that of the somen noodles, and this method of distinguishing the noodles became inappropriate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, hiyamugi noodles nowadays are made by almost the same manufacturing method as that of the somen noodles, and this method of distinguishing the noodles became inappropriate.
However, hiyamugi noodles nowadays are made by almost the same manufacturing method as that of the somen noodles, and this method of distinguishing the noodles became inappropriate.

sen.j: また素麺と食べ方が同じことや食感も類似していることから、一般的にはうどんより、そうめんの一種として扱われるようになっている。
sen.e: Furthermore, in general, they are treated as a type of somen noodles rather than udon noodles because they are eaten in the same manner as the somen noodles, and also because their mouth feel is similar to that of the somen noodles.

Furthermore, in general, they are treated as a type of somen noodles rather than udon noodles because they are eaten in the same manner as somen noodles, and also because their texture is similar to that of the somen noodles.

Furthermore, in general, they are treated as a type of somen noodles rather than udon noodles because they are eaten in the same manner as somen noodles, and also because their texture is similar to that of the somen noodles.

sen.j: 日本にて細い麺を食べる文化は奈良時代の初期に中国から伝えられた麦縄から始まったという説が広まっている。
sen.e: There is a widely accepted theory that the culture of eating thin noodles in Japan began with the muginawa (wheat rope) that was introduced from China during the early Nara period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a widely accepted theory that the culture of eating thin noodles in Japan began with the muginawa (wheat rope) that was introduced from China during the early Nara period.
There is a widely accepted theory that the culture of eating thin noodles in Japan began with the muginawa (wheat rope) that was introduced from China during the early Nara period.

sen.j: しかし、その具体的な形状がよく解明されておらず長い間手伸ばし・手延べの麺と考えられている。
sen.e: However, the specific shape of the noodles are not understood well, and it has been considered for a long time that they were hand-stretched or hand-made type noodles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the specific shape of the noodles are not understood well, and it has been considered for a long time that they were a type of hand-stretched or hand-made noodle.
However, the specific shape of the noodles are not understood well, and it has been considered for a long time that they were a type of hand-stretched or hand-made noodle.

sen.j: 現在の素麺に近いスタイルの索麺（そうめん）が普及するようになるのは室町時代に入ってからである。
sen.e: Somen noodles similar in style to the present-day somen noodles became widely available during the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Somen noodles similar in style to the present-day somen noodles became widely available during the Muromachi period.
Somen noodles similar in style to the present-day somen noodles became widely available during the Muromachi period.

sen.j: その時代の文献には新たな製法、包丁などの刃物で切って作る麺（切り麺）が登場した。
sen.e: Noodles made by a new method of cutting with a knife, such as a clever (cut noodles), appear in the written records from that period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Noodles made by a new method of cutting with a knife, such as a clever (cut noodles), appear in the written records from that period.
Noodles made by a new method of cutting with a knife, such as a cleaver (cut noodles), appear in the written records from that period.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 一条兼良が書いたとされる『往来物』には索麺は熱蒸、截麦（きりむぎ）は冷濯（ひやしあらい） との一節がある。
sen.e: In "Oraimono" (a primary textbook in the style of exchanging of letters), which said to have been written by Kanera ICHIJO, there is a passage that states that somen noodles are steamed, and kirimugi noodles (cold noodles) are cold washed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処、用語集には熱蒸は fine white noodles, 冷濯は cold noodles とありましたが、それぞれ steamed と cold washed にしておきました。
sen.e: In "Oraimono" (a primary textbook in the style of exchanging of letters), which said to have been written by Kanera ICHIJO, there is a passage that states that somen noodles are steamed, and kirimugi noodles (cold noodles) are cold washed.

In "Oraimono" (a primary textbook in the style of exchanging of letters), which said to have been written by Kanera ICHIJO, there is a passage that states that somen noodles are steamed, and kirimugi noodles (cold noodles) are cold washed.

sen.j: 当時索麺は蒸して熱いところを食べるのが主流で、截麦は冷やして食べるのが主流だったと伺える。
sen.e: It can be seen that at that time, somen noodles were mainly eaten hot after they were steamed, and the kirimugi noodles were usually eaten chilled.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It can be seen that at that time, somen noodles were mainly eaten hot after they were steamed, while kirimugi noodles were usually eaten chilled.
It can be seen that at that time, somen noodles were mainly eaten hot after they were steamed, while kirimugi noodles were usually eaten chilled.

sen.j: また15世紀の日記類には、截麦のほか、切麺、切麦、冷麦、冷麺、切冷麺 といった言葉が頻繁に出ている。
sen.e: Furthermore, words such as kirimen (cut noodles), kirimugi (cut wheat noodles), hiyamugi, reimen (Korean-style cold noodles) and kirireimen (cold cut noodles) are mentioned often besides kirimugi in diaries from the 15th century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処, 冷麺は用語集に cold noodles (in Korean style) となってましたので、Korean-style を訳文に使いました。
sen.e: Furthermore, words such as kirimen (cut noodles), kirimugi (cut wheat noodles), hiyamugi, reimen (Korean-style cold noodles) and kirireimen (cold cut noodles) are frequently mentioned beside kirimugi in diaries from the 15th century.

Furthermore, words such as kirimen (cut noodles), kirimugi (cut wheat noodles), hiyamugi, reimen (Korean-style cold noodles) and kirireimen (cold cut noodles) are frequently mentioned beside kirimugi in diaries from the 15th century.

sen.j: 同時代に頻繁に登場するようになった「うどん」とは明確に区別されている。
sen.e: They are clearly distinguished from 'udon' noodles, which also began to appear often during the same period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They are clearly distinguished from 'udon' noodles, which also began to appear frequently during the same period.
They are clearly distinguished from 'udon' noodles, which also began to appear frequently during the same period.

sen.j: それとは形状の異なる切り麺であり、素麺と並べて論じられているので、形状は素麺に近い細い切り麺と推測される。
sen.e: Hiyamugi noodles are cut noodles that have a shape different from the udon noodles, and because they are also discussed in conjunction with somen noodles, it can be assumed that they are cut noodles whose shape is close to that of some noodles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処、原文の「それ」は「ひやむぎ」と解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: Hiyamugi noodles are cut noodles that have a shape different from the udon noodles, and because they are also discussed in conjunction with somen noodles, it can be assumed that they are cut noodles whose shape is close to that of some noodles.

Hiyamugi noodles are cut noodles that have a shape different from the udon noodles, and because they are also discussed in conjunction with somen noodles, it can be assumed that they are cut noodles whose shape is close to that of somen noodles.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: そして、「冷麦」の読みは明らかに「ひやむぎ」であるため、この時期には「素麺に近い細い切り麺＝ひやむぎ」という概念は誕生していた模様である。
sen.e: Furthermore, because the pronunciation of 'hiyamugi' (chilled wheat) is undoubtedly 'hiyamugi,' it seems that during this period the concept of 'cut noodles similar to somen = hiyamugi' was already born.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, because the pronunciation of the kanji characters for 'chilled wheat' is undoubtedly 'hiyamugi,' it seems that during this period the concept of 'cut noodles similar to somen = hiyamugi' was already born.

Furthermore, because the pronunciation of the kanji characters for 'chilled wheat' is undoubtedly 'hiyamugi,' it seems that during this period the concept of 'cut noodles similar to somen = hiyamugi' was already born.

sen.j: 時代が過ぎ元禄10年の本草書『本朝食鑑』では、うどんは寒い時期のものであり、ひやむぎは暑い時期に良い との内容で書かれている。
sen.e: After some time had passed it was written in honsosho (book of herbs) "Honcho shokkan" (mirror of food in our country) of the 10th year of Genroku (1697), whose content stated that udon noodles were items for the cold period and hiyamugi noodles were good for the hot period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After some time had passed it was written in the 1697 honsosho (book of herbs) "Honcho shokkan" (mirror of food in our country) that udon noodles were items for cold times and hiyamugi noodles were good for hot times.

After some time had passed it was written in the 1697 honsosho (book of herbs) "Honcho shokkan" (mirror of food in our country) that udon noodles were items for cold times and hiyamugi noodles were good for hot times.

sen.j: この時代にはうどんとひやむぎの季節による食べ分けが定着していたと推測される。
sen.e: Therefore, it can be assumed that the custom of eating udon and hiyamugi noodles according to the seasons was already established during this period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it can be assumed that the custom of eating udon and hiyamugi noodles according to the seasons was already established during this period.
Therefore, it can be assumed that the custom of eating udon and hiyamugi noodles according to the seasons was already established during this period.

sen.j: 他には、小麦粉を水で練ったものを細く切り、茹でて食べるものを「切り麦」と呼んでいたが、これを暖めて食べるものを「饂飩」、冷やして食べるものを「冷麦」と分けたから という説がある。
sen.e: Additionally, there is a theory that states that there were noodles called 'kirimugi' that were made by kneading wheat flour and water, cut into strips, then boiled and eaten, and a distinction was made between those eaten warm as 'udon' and those eaten chilled as 'hiyamugi.'

Additionally, there is a theory that states that there were noodles called 'kirimugi' that were made by kneading wheat flour and water, cut into strips, then boiled and eaten, and a distinction was made between those eaten warm as 'udon' and those eaten chilled as 'hiyamugi.'

Additionally, there is a theory that states that there were noodles called 'kirimugi' that were made by kneading wheat flour and water, cut into strips, then boiled and eaten, and a distinction was made between those eaten warm as 'udon' and those eaten chilled as 'hiyamugi.'

sen.j: さらに、うどんが温かさを保つために太くなっているのに対し、ひやむぎは、より冷たい状態で食べるため次第に細くなっていった という説がある。
sen.e: Furthermore, there is a theory that states that while udon noodles are thick in order to retain heat, hiyamugi noodles are eaten in a colder state so that they gradually became thin.
Furthermore, there is a theory stating that while udon noodles are thick in order to retain heat, hiyamugi noodles gradually became thin because they are eaten at cooler temperature.
Furthermore, there is a theory stating that while udon noodles are thick in order to retain heat, hiyamugi noodles gradually became thin because they are eaten at cooler temperature.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、小文字にしました。

sen.j: 素麺と同様であり、ゆでて氷水や流水で冷し、ぬめりを取るためもみ洗いをしたのち、めんつゆにつけて食べるのが一般的である。
sen.e: As with some noodles, they are commonly eaten with a dipping sauce after they are boiled, chilled in ice water or in running water, and then rubbed and rinsed in order to remove the sticky starch.
As with somen noodles, they are commonly eaten with a dipping sauce after having been boiled, chilled in ice water or running water, and then rubbed and rinsed in order to remove the sticky starch.
As with somen noodles, they are commonly eaten with a dipping sauce after having been boiled, chilled in ice water or running water, and then rubbed and rinsed in order to remove the sticky starch.

sen.j: ゆでる水には塩を入れない。
sen.e: Salt is not added to the water for boiling.
Salt is not added to the water for boiling.
Salt is not added to the water for boiling.

sen.j: これは麺に含まれる塩分を出すためである。
sen.e: This is so that the salt can be removed from the noodles.
This is so that the salt can be removed from the noodles.
This is so that the salt can be removed from the noodles.

sen.j: 細い麺であり他の味が移りやすいため、出来るだけ良い水で洗い、手油を避ける必要がある。
sen.e: Because the noodles are thin other flavors are easily transferred to the noodles, and therefore it is necessary to avoid oil from the hands and to wash them in water of the highest possible quality.

Because the noodles are thin, they readily take up other flavors, and it is therefore necessary to wash the hands in water as thoroughly as possible in order to avoid oil from the hands coming into contact with them.
sen.cmt: Reworded to read more naturally and better reflect meaning of source text.
sen.e: Because the noodles are thin, they readily take up other flavors, and it is therefore necessary to wash the hands in water as thoroughly as possible in order to avoid oil from the hands coming into contact with them.

sen.j: めんつゆは醤油、ダシ、砂糖などからなる甘辛いものである。
sen.e: The dipping sauce is sweet and salty, made of soy sauce, dashi broth, sugar and others.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The salty-sweet dipping sauce is made of ingredients including soy sauce, dashi stock and sugar.
The salty-sweet dipping sauce is made of ingredients including soy sauce, dashi stock and sugar.

sen.j: 食べる前日に作るのがよいとされる。
sen.e: It is preferable to make it the day before eating the noodles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処、訳文には「麺を食べる前日に」としてあります。
sen.e: It is preferable to make it the day before eating the noodles.
It is preferable to make it the day before eating the noodles.

sen.j: ごまだれをめんつゆに入れたりつけ汁として用いるケースもある。
sen.e: There are cases in which sesame sauce is used as a dipping sauce or added to the dipping sauce.
There are cases in which sesame sauce is used as a dipping sauce or added to the dipping sauce.
There are cases in which sesame sauce is used as a dipping sauce or added to the dipping sauce.

sen.j: 付け合わせには、煮込んだシイタケや錦糸卵等をつける場合もある。
sen.e: In some cases garnishes such as braised shiitake mushrooms and julienned strips of thin omelet are used.
In some cases garnishes such as braised shiitake mushrooms and julienned strips of thin omelet are used.
In some cases garnishes such as braised shiitake mushrooms and julienned strips of thin omelet are used.

sen.j: 薬味としては、刻み葱、おろし生姜、ゴマ、ミョウガなどが用いられる。
sen.e: Minced scallions, grated ginger, sesame seeds and Japanese ginger are used as condiments.
Chopped spring onions, grated ginger, sesame seeds and Japanese ginger are used as condiments.
Chopped spring onions, grated ginger, sesame seeds and Japanese ginger are used as condiments.

sen.j: 他に素麺と同様の食べ方が可能であり、詳しくは素麺食べ方を参照。
sen.e: It is possible to eat the noodles in the same way as the somen noodles, and The Way Somen Noodles Are Eaten should be referred to for details.
It is possible to eat the noodles in the same way as the somen noodles, and 'The Way Somen Noodles Are Eaten' should be referred to for details.

sen.cmt: 一部タイトルを小文字にしました。

sen.j: 冷麦はそうめんと違い、西日本一帯では知名度が低いとも言われている。
sen.e: Unlike somen noodles, hiyamugi noodles are said to be not well known in areas around western Japan.
Unlike somen noodles, hiyamugi noodles are said not to be well known in western Japan.
Unlike somen noodles, hiyamugi noodles are said not to be well known in western Japan.

sen.j: 東京近郊の蕎麦屋では冷麦は蕎麦と茹で上げる時間がほぼ同じであることが多いため、夏場にはそうめんではなく、冷麦を供している場合が多い。
sen.e: Because hiyamugi noodles often boil in just about the same amount of time as the soba noodles, hiyamugi noodles are often served instead of somen noodles during summer in soba noodle shops in and around Tokyo.

Because hiyamugi noodles often boil in just about the same amount of time as the soba noodles, hiyamugi noodles are often served instead of somen noodles during summer in soba noodle shops in and around Tokyo.

Because hiyamugi noodles often boil in just about the same amount of time as the soba noodles, hiyamugi noodles are often served instead of somen noodles during summer in soba noodle shops in and around Tokyo.

sen.j: ひやむぎの麺に赤や緑の彩色麺が数本入っている場合もある（素麺にも入っているケースもある）。
sen.e: There are cases where few strands of colored noodles, such as red or green ones, are included among the hiyamugi noodles (there are cases where they are also included in somen noodles).
There are cases in which several strands of colored noodles, such as red or green ones, are included among the hiyamugi noodles (there are cases where they are also included in somen noodles).
There are cases in which several strands of colored noodles, such as red or green ones, are included among the hiyamugi noodles (there are cases where they are also included in somen noodles).

sen.j: これは、製麺所がひやむぎの麺束にこれらの彩色麺を混入しているためである。
sen.e: This is because the noodle factory adds colored noodles to the bundles of hiyamugi noodles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is because noodle factories add colored noodles to the bundles of hiyamugi noodles.
This is because noodle factories add colored noodles to the bundles of hiyamugi noodles.

sen.j: これによりそうめんと冷麦を区別していた。
sen.e: They were used to tell the difference between somen noodles and hiyamugi noodles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were used to tell the difference between somen noodles and hiyamugi noodles.
They were used to tell the difference between somen noodles and hiyamugi noodles.

sen.j: この風習は1980年代後半までは関東地方（東京）などを中心に多く見られた。
sen.e: This tradition was often seen in the regions around Kanto area (Tokyo) until the latter half of the 1980's.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This tradition was often seen in the regions around Kanto area (Tokyo) until the latter half of the 1980's.
This tradition was often seen in the regions around Kanto area (Tokyo) until the latter half of the 1980's.

sen.j: しかし、1990年代には徐々に縮小していき大多数が白一色のひやむぎになってしまった。
sen.e: However, it gradually became less common, and the majority of the hiyamugi noodles became all white during the 1990's.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it gradually became less common, and the majority of the hiyamugi noodles became white during the 1990's.
However, it gradually became less common, and the majority of the hiyamugi noodles became white during the 1990's.

sen.j: しかしその一方で揖保乃糸など一部の製造業者が現在でもこの風習を続けている。
sen.e: On the other hand, however, some manufacturers such as Ibo no Ito is continuing the tradition even to this day.
On the other hand, however, some manufacturers such as Ibo no Ito continue the tradition even to this day.
On the other hand, however, some manufacturers such as Ibo no Ito continue the tradition even to this day.

sen.j: 色のついた麺が入っていると子供が喜ぶ為、近年ではそうめんにも入れられていることがある。
sen.e: Because children get excited when they see colored noodles these noodles are sometimes added to somen noodles in the recent years.
Because children get excited when they see colored noodles, they have come to sometimes be added to somen noodles in recent years.
Because children get excited when they see colored noodles, they have come to sometimes be added to somen noodles in recent years.

sen.j: 北海道ではクロレラ粉末を混ぜた、緑色のひやむぎ「グリンめん」が多く流通している。
sen.e: In Hokkaido, green hiyamugi noodles called 'green men,' made by mixing in powdered chlorella, are widely distributed.
In Hokkaido, green hiyamugi noodles called 'green men,' made by mixing in powdered chlorella, are widely distributed.
In Hokkaido, green hiyamugi noodles called 'green men,' made by mixing in powdered chlorella, are widely distributed.

sen.j: 山梨県では甲斐国方言にて、ひやむぎ等の麺類を「おだら」「おざら」と呼称する地域もある。
sen.e: In Yamanashi Prefecture, there are regions in which noodles such as hiyamugi are called 'odara' or 'ozara' because of the Kai province dialect.
